intro: Dolicholobium moluccense, commonly known as the Moluccan dolicholobium, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to the Moluccas, an archipelago in Indonesia, and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated pods and trifoliate leaves. The plant typically grows in tropical rainforest environments, where it thrives in humid, shaded conditions. Its flowers are small and clustered, often in dense inflorescences, and it produces yellow or orange blooms. Dolicholobium moluccense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
